name: Incomes across the Distribution Database (authored by Nolan, Thewissen, Roser; based on LIS) indexed to the first year (2016)
title: Incomes across the Distribution Database (authored by Nolan, Thewissen, Roser; based on LIS) indexed to the first year (2016)
description: The decile cut-offs  are calculated on the basis of disposable household income. The measure of disposable household income employed in the Luxembourg Income Study is paid employment and self-employment income, capital income, transfer income, which includes social security transfers (work-related insurance transfers, universal benefits, and assistance benefits) and private transfers, minus income taxes and social security contributions. This follows the definitions of the Canberra Group.

sources.name: Incomes across the Distribution Database (authored by Nolan, Thewissen, Roser; based on LIS) indexed to the first year (2016)
sources.dataPublisherSource: Based on microdata from the Luxembourg Income Study Database
sources.link: The entire database was published by Brian Nolan, Stefan Thewissen here https://ourworldindata.org/incomes-across-the-distribution/
sources.additionalInfo: The decile cut-offs  are calculated on the basis of disposable household income. The measure of disposable household income employed in the Luxembourg Income Study is paid employment and self-employment income, capital income, transfer income, which includes social security transfers (work-related insurance transfers, universal benefits, and assistance benefits) and private transfers, minus income taxes and social security contributions. This follows the definitions of the Canberra Group.
